Dear Dr. Moss:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(b) The services provided to residents and parents directly by
the institution and the services provided by outside
resources.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The program is licensed to serve youth between the ages of 13-17
years of age but has stated that they are unable to meet the
educational requirements for youth of middle school ages.
Investigation The Complainant was interviewed over the phone on 05/09/2024
and had no other information to provide.
The Chief Administrator was interviewed on 05/20/2024 over the
phone. After researching their agreement with the service
provider, Success Virtual Academy, that provides educational
services to the program, he confirmed the arrangement is not able
to offer schooling to youth prior to high school grades. The Chief
Administrator confirmed the facility had recently declined
placement of a 13 year old youth in part due to the facility not
being able to offer educational services. He stated the facility has
been discussing steps needed to allow for the current educational
programming to expand to younger youth but that would not be
likely soon because of the requirements needed of the service
provider. The Chief Administrator also recognized the current
license terms include an age range of youth starting at 13 years
old.
Documents reviewed:
• Email communication regarding the possible placement of
the youth referenced above was received. On 05/07/2024
the Chief Administrator stated to DHHS Staff 1 the
placement of the youth in the facility could not occur
because their “education partners do not cater to middle
school youth currently and achieving accreditation to serve
this demographic is still a year away.”
• Documentation from the educational service provider for
the facility, Success Virtual Academy, was provided on
2

05/28/2024. Their website stated they serve youth in grade
9 or higher and from the ages of 14-21.
• An excerpt from a Memo of Understanding between the
facility and the educational service provider was provided
by the Chief Administrator on 05/30/2024. There were no
details in this documentation regarding what grade level of
youth can be served.
• The Program Statement for the facility was reviewed. This
referred to the program serving male youth between the
ages of 13-20. A description of educational programming
was included and indicated education services will be
provided to youth but did not reference specific grade levels
that could be serviced.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as their program
statement and available services did not match the educational
services they were able to offer a youth within their licensing
terms.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
